availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hiram McIlvaine Pearce (Mason County, Kentucky, medical student and physician)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, medical student and physician. Kentucky native. Son of Lewis C. Pearce and Eliza Ann Stockwell Pearce. Resident of Mason County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Mason County in 1850. Attended school in Mason County in 1860. Household owned five enslaved persons in Mason County in 1860. Attended Miami University Medical College in Butler County, Ohio from 1862 to 1863. Graduate of Ohio Medical College in Cincinnati in 1865. Attended the Bellevue Hospital Medical College in New York City, New York, from 1865 to 1868.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 689.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 320.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 4B.
U.S., Passport Applications, 1795-1925, General Records of the Department of State, NARA Series M1372, RG 59, Roll 137, Application 24348.
W.J. Maxwell, ed. General Alumni Catalogue of New York University, 1916 (New York, Published for NY University, 1916), p. 269.
General Catalogue of the Graduates and Former Students of Miami University, Including Members of the Board of Trustees and Faculty During its First Century, 1809-1909, (Oxford: Miami University, 1909), p. 306.
Frederick A. Castle, Second Decennial Catalogue of the Trustees, Faculty, Officers, and of the Alumni of the Bellevue Hospital Medical College of the City of New York, 1861-1881, (New York: Published by the Association, 1884), p. 72.
